gapackage 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

    A class to connstruct, execute and analyse a genetic algorithm.

    ga.Rd

    This class will store data during the execution of a genetic algorithm. As well as this, it contains a number of methods to interact with the algorithm and UI functionality to view the results and ammend parameters during execution.

    Details

    To get started, using the new() method to begin.

    Public fields

    par

    a named list containing function parameters

    dim

    the dimensions of the population array

    population

    the population array

    operators

    an ordered list of the operator functions

    dependents

    function used by the operators

    metrics

    a list containing custom metrics stored during the execution of the simulation

    output_graphs

    a list of functions that produce a 2D graph (UI only)

    time

    the number of operators that have been executed

    paused

    whether the simulation is paused or not (UI only)

    speed

    the number of generations executed every second (UI only)

    store_data

    boolean which determines the amount of information which is stored

    stored_df

    data frame used to store metric data

    current_generation

    the number of times that every operators has been executed

    shiny_ui

    the UI code (UI only)

    shiny_server

    variable to store the shiny server function

    Methods

    Public methods

    • ga$new()

    • ga$add_operators()

    • ga$add_operator()

    • ga$add_metric()

    • ga$add_dependents()

    • ga$add_dependent()

    • ga$next_operator()

    • ga$next_iteration()

    • ga$generate_server()

    • ga$add_output_graph()

    • ga$add_output_graphs()

    • ga$run_ui()

    • ga$save_data()

    • ga$clone()

    Method new()

    This method allows you to initialize a ga class instance.

    Usage

    ga$new(dim, initial, parameters = list(), store_data = FALSE)

    Arguments

    dim

    the dimensions of the population array, with the last dimension being the size of the population.

    initial

    the function used to generate the initial population.

    parameters

    a named list containing parameters used in the operator and dependancy function

    store_data

    a boolean value which indicates how much data is stored during the simulation.

    Examples

    brach <- gapackage::ga$new(
dim = c(10, 1000),
parameters = list(
 initial_min     = 0,
 B_x             = 180,
 initial_max     = 40,
 A_y             = 40,
 geno_length     = 2,
 g               = 9.81,
 remove          = 0.5,
 add_proportion  = 0.5,
 mutation_size   = 0.0000007,
 generations     = 100,
 population_size = 3000,
 maximise        = FALSE,
 location        = 0,
 minkowski_p     = 100
 ),
 store_data = FALSE,
 initial = initial_rand_uni_3d
);

    Method add_operators()

    A method to add an operator / operators to the genetic algorithm.

    Usage

    ga$add_operators(operators)

    Arguments

    operators

    a single function or a list of functions which have an operator structure.

    Examples

    brach$add_operators(
  operators = list(
    mutation_cauchy,
    crossover_basic_3d
  )
)

brach$add_operators(
   mutation_cauchy
)

    Method add_operator()

    A method to add single operator to the genetic algorithm

    Usage

    ga$add_operator(operator)

    Arguments

    operator

    a single function which has an operator structure.

    Details

    It is recommended that you use the add_operators() function instead.

    Method add_metric()

    A method to add a metric to track during the simulation

    Usage

    ga$add_metric(name, value)

    Arguments

    name

    the name of the metric you want to track.

    value

    the expression corresponding to the value of the metric.

    Details

    This should only be run in either a dependency or an operator function.

    Examples

    self$add_metric(name = "average_fitness", value = sum(fitnesses) / length(fitnesses));

    Method add_dependents()

    A method to add a single dependency or a list of multiple dependencies

    Usage

    ga$add_dependents(dependents)

    Arguments

    dependents

    a single dependency or a list of multiple dependancies

    Examples

    brach$add_dependents(
  dependents = list(
    fitness_function_single = utility_fitness_brachistochrone_3d,
    fitness_function = utility_fitness_population_3d
  )
)

    Method add_dependent()

    A method to add a single dependency function.

    Usage

    ga$add_dependent(dependent)

    Arguments

    dependent

    a named list containing one dependent.

    Examples

    brach$add_dependents(
  dependents = list(
    fitness_function_single = utility_fitness_brachistochrone_3d
  )
)

    Method next_operator()

    A method to run the next operator in the ordered operators list.

    Usage

    ga$next_operator()

    Examples

    brach$next_operator()

    Method next_iteration()

    A method to run through all the operators once.

    Usage

    ga$next_iteration()

    Examples

    brach$next_iteration()

    Method generate_server()

    A method to generate the R Shiny server function (UI Only)

    Usage

    ga$generate_server()

    Returns

    a function intended to be used as an R Shiny server function.

    Examples

    brach$generate_server()

    Method add_output_graph()

    a method to add an output graph to the output tab in the UI (UI Only)

    Usage

    ga$add_output_graph(parameters)

    Arguments

    parameters

    a named list containing a function and chart output settings

    Examples

    brach$add_output_graph(
 list(
   xlab = "horizontal distance",
   ylab = "vertical distance",
   FUN = manhattan_plot
 )
)

    Method add_output_graphs()

    a method to add multiple output graphs to the output tab in the UI (UI Only)

    Usage

    ga$add_output_graphs(parameters)

    Arguments

    parameters

    a list containing many named lists which contain multiple function and chart output settings

    Examples

    brach$add_output_graphs(
 list(
   list(
     xlab = "horizontal distance",
     ylab = "vertical distance",
     FUN = manhattan_plot
   ),
   list(
     xlab = "horizontal distance",
     ylab = "vertical distance",
     FUN = manhattan_plot
   )
 )
)

    Method run_ui()

    A method to open the UI.

    Usage

    ga$run_ui()

    Details

    You should only have one localhost open at any particular time.

    Method save_data()

    A method to save the data stored during the simulation

    Usage

    ga$save_data(path)

    Arguments

    path

    the path of the csv file that will be created.

    Method clone()

    The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

    Usage

    ga$clone(deep = FALSE)

    Arguments

    deep

    Whether to make a deep clone.

    Examples

    
## ------------------------------------------------
## Method `ga$new`
## ------------------------------------------------

brach <- gapackage::ga$new(
dim = c(10, 1000),
parameters = list(
 initial_min     = 0,
 B_x             = 180,
 initial_max     = 40,
 A_y             = 40,
 geno_length     = 2,
 g               = 9.81,
 remove          = 0.5,
 add_proportion  = 0.5,
 mutation_size   = 0.0000007,
 generations     = 100,
 population_size = 3000,
 maximise        = FALSE,
 location        = 0,
 minkowski_p     = 100
 ),
 store_data = FALSE,
 initial = initial_rand_uni_3d
);
